data.question: What are the two types of nanocages mentioned in the synthesis?
What is the maximum uptake capacity for CrO4 2- and ReO4 - by the synthesized material?
data.answer: 83.2 mg g-1 for CrO4 2- and 218 mg g-1 for ReO4 -

data.question: How many times can the catalyst be reused without obvious loss in catalytic activity?
What is the turnover frequency (TOF) value achieved for the enamination of ethyl acetoacetate with aniline?
What is the significance of the interlocked [Cu8] and [Cu18] nanocages in the catalyst's performance?
data.answer: They contribute to the catalyst's high activity, excellent selectivity, and size-selectivity towards various substrates.

data.question: Why is the catalyst able to exhibit size selectivity?
data.answer: The windows in the interlocked cages allow the entry of small-sized substrates and limit the diffusion of large-sized substrates to the active sites.

data.question: Is the synthesized material the first example of a catalyst that exhibits size-selectivity towards various substrates in the enamination reaction?
Does the catalyst maintain its catalytic activity after being recycled for more than five cycles?
Is the enamination reaction catalyzed by the synthesized material limited to ethyl acetoacetate and aniline only?
Can the synthesized material capture both anionic pollutants and radioactive-contaminant simulants effectively?
Was the interlocking of different types of cages previously reported before this study?
Does the synthesized material exhibit high thermal stability?
Is the synthesized material's catalytic activity for the enamination reaction unaffected by the size of the substrate molecules?
What ligands are used in the assembly of the [Cu8] and [Cu18] nanocages?
What is the role of coordinately unsaturated Cu centers in the catalyst?
data.answer: They serve as Lewis-acid sites and activate the substrate through a synergistic effect to promote the enamination reaction.

data.question: What method was used to synthesize the blue crystals of the material?
What is the effect of electron-withdrawing groups on the catalytic activity?
data.answer: They can decrease the yield of the reaction, as seen with 4-chloroephenylamine.

data.question: What analytical techniques were used to study the reaction mechanism?
Did the catalyst show any loss in catalytic activity after ten cycles?
Is the synthesized material the first reported structure to feature the interlocking of different types of cages?
